016package com.exoreaction.xorcery.process;
017
018import com.exoreaction.xorcery.lang.Exceptions;
019
020import java.util.Map;
021import java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture;
022import java.util.concurrent.CompletionStage;
023import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap;
024import java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit;
025import java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicLong;
026
027/**
028 * Long-running process that normally involves I/O to other systems.
029 * Can perform optional retries with backoff if possible, and can be cancelled through the provided future.
030 * If the process generates a result this can be returned using the provided future as well.
031 *
032 * @param <T> type of the result, may be Void
033 */
034public interface Process<T> {
035
036    Map<Process<?>, AtomicLong> failures = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
037
038    void start();
039
040    default void stop() {
041        result().toCompletableFuture().cancel(true);
042    }
043
044    default void succeeded() {
045        failures.remove(this);
046    }
047
048    default void retry() {
049
050        if (result().toCompletableFuture().isCancelled())
051            return;
052
053        AtomicLong nrOfFailures = failures.getOrDefault(this, new AtomicLong(0L));
054        long delay = getFailureDelay(nrOfFailures.getAndIncrement());
055
056
057        CompletableFuture.delayedExecutor(delay, TimeUnit.SECONDS).execute(()->
058        {
059            if (result().toCompletableFuture().isCancelled())
060                return;
061
062            start();
063        });
064    }
065
066    default long getFailureDelay(long failureCount)
067    {
068        return Math.min(failureCount * 10L, 60L);
069    }
070
071    default boolean isRetryable(Throwable t) {
072        return false;
073    }
074
075    default void complete(T value, Throwable t) {
076
077        if (result().toCompletableFuture().isCancelled())
078            return;
079
080        if (t != null) {
081            t = Exceptions.unwrap(t);
082            if (isRetryable(t)) {
083                retry();
084            } else {
085                result().toCompletableFuture().completeExceptionally(t);
086            }
087        } else {
088            result().toCompletableFuture().complete(value);
089        }
090    }
091
092    CompletionStage<T> result();
093}
